//: Dairy farmer's son in the Isherwood family.

name: Luke Isherwood
job_description: I'm Eddie's son, part of the Isherwood family

dynamic_line.yes: I see that badge, you should leave before my father sees you.

responses.text: Your dad said you were out here fixing up this place.
Hey, What are you doing out here?
Can I do anything for you?

dynamic_line: Yeah, I work on it when I have the time.  I can't leave the farm too long, so I can't find some things I need.

responses.text: Must be tough having the world fall apart when you had you future to look forward to.

dynamic_line: I've been cleaning up this old building to make it into a workshop.  I want to put up a pottery kiln and forge.  My dad doesn't want me leaving the farm to find some things, says it is too dangerous.
I know all the grown ups worry about us, but I think we can adapt better than them in the long run.  Chris has some interesting thoughts on the matter.

responses.text: What sort of ideas does Chris have?
That is a good idea, what do you need?
I'm not interested right now, I'd better get going.

dynamic_line: Things have been tough for my dad since Barry was captured.  He works till he falls asleep most nights..
Chris is a little older than me, he's up at the horse farm with his parents and sister, Lisa.

Well, he doesn't agree that what we're doing here will last.  He thinks things will only get worse.  It's tough to get the adults to listen though, much less agree with his solution.  You can go talk to him more about it if you want.
You won't find any help here.

responses.text: Must be tough having the world fall apart when you had you future to look forward to.

name: Find The Art of Glassblowing book

dialogue.describe: I need more knowledge to get the glass blowing started.
dialogue.offer: I could really use a book on glass blowing.  With the internet gone, I don't have any handy references.
dialogue.accepted: Fantastic, I'm not supposed to leave our land.
dialogue.rejected: Oh well, figured I'd have to do a lot of practice anyway.
dialogue.advice: A library, bookstore or a glass blower's studio should have one.
dialogue.success: I appreciate it, this will make my life so much easier.
dialogue.failure: At least you escaped with your life…
